question: How is my refund actually determined?
answer: When you registered your plates, you paid $137.50, which was for two years. This amount included $62.50, which was the registration fee for two years, that is $31.25 per year. Also included was $50.00 for the title certificate and then $25.00 for the vehicle plates. The registration fee for one year is refunded to you, as you surrendered the plates during the first year of registration
model_answer: When you surrender your plates, your Receipt FS-6 T indicates if you are eligible to receive a refund. If you are eligible for a refund and you do not request a transfer receipt, we will process your refund automatically and you will receive it in the mail in several weeks. If you are not eligible for a refund or you request a transfer receipt, the DMV office issues a Receipt FS-6 T that you can use to transfer the registration to another vehicle.

You surrender the vehicle plates during the first year of the registration ,
attribution: If you are not eligible for a refund or you request a transfer receipt , the DMV office issues a Receipt FS-6 T that you can use to transfer the registration to another vehicle.

question: What things should I know in relation to travelling speed of my vehicle and the correct distances that should be kept between myself and other vehicles during the road test
answer: Applicants should abide by the relevant speed limits, being mindful of the weather conditions/road conditions/visibility and traffic conditions that are prevalent.
